Can someone please, either point me in the right direction of a mod that has nothing but decouplers, or can someone PLEASE make a mod that has decouplers. BOTH vertical, and radial. (What ever the directional terminology is)

I am having the hardest time searching for mods that have a large selection of decouplers. I downloaded KW Rocketry and a lot of those fuel and solid rocket boosters are HUGE, and the little stock decouplers arent cutting it.

Thank you for taking the time to read this and I hope to find a decoupler mod pack soon.

:)

of black mystery. It takes more than a moment to fully realize this is Earth . . . This is our...HOME.
Why not just try and rescale the decouplers you want to use ?

Ive always thought that the decoupler mechanics were a bit finicky like the landing gear. If not just right, tanks will be spun off wildly, explode, or barely go anywhere most times all three.

Need to get them as close as possible to the center of mass do the part thats being decoupled, then play with the sepratrons until it goes the way ya want it.

Adding too much decouple force to a decoupler can cause fuel tanks to explode, I've experienced this with both KW and NP parts when using odd fuel tanks.

Can someone please, either point me in the right direction of a mod that has nothing but decouplers, or can someone PLEASE make a mod that has decouplers. BOTH vertical, and radial. (What ever the directional terminology is)

I am having the hardest time searching for mods that have a large selection of decouplers. I downloaded KW Rocketry and a lot of those fuel and solid rocket boosters are HUGE, and the little stock decouplers arent cutting it.

Thank you for taking the time to read this and I hope to find a decoupler mod pack soon.

:)

I thought I saw a mod that enabled scaling. I will DL it and try it out. thanks

But the reason I requested it is because, I am no good at making any kind of mods, and when I see these engine, fuel tank, and booster mods come out and they dont have a selection of radial decouplers to go with them, it just strikes me as odd. Because sometimes when I attach radial decouplers to a mod tank or booster, it doesnt exactly match up with the texture/surface of the tank. And when its not attached properly it will spin wildly, blow up, or not work all together.

I would have thought that radial decouplers would be an automatic kind of thing to include with RADIALLY connected hardware. But if you say that decouplers are finiky then I guess ill take your word for it. Because I know absolutely nothing about making mods. I wouldnt know the first thing. Just installing mods was a 2 hour ordeal for me. :-\
